intro: Myrsine novocaledonica subsp. piroguensis, commonly known as the Piroguen myrsine, is a shrub native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
